content:
Is there a scenario where a crate that is being compiled could somehow override cargos default number of compile jobs?

I have dualcore system, so usually cargo launches at most 4 jobs.
When building veloren however, https://gitlab.com/veloren/veloren ( just normal cargo build --release ) I see it launching up to 7 jobs at a time
Building [===================> ] 658/803: spirv_cross(build), veloren-voxygen-dynlib, libsqlite3-sys(build), libsqlite3-sys(build), wgpu-types, pistoncore-input, tracing-subscriber

Any ideas how this happens?
Do the (build) ones not count in the calculation perhaps?

something is definitely weird.. even if I build with one job cargo build --release -j 1 it seems to launch two..?
Building [==================> ] 642/803: shaderc-sys(build), spirv_cross(build)
